intro: Bakeridesia yucatana, commonly known as the Yucatan cactus, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in local cuisine. Bakeridesia yucatana plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
